intro: Paepalanthus alpinus, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 3,000 meters. It is adapted to cold climates and has a short growing season. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
